Don’t let your baby’s head 
become covered
Babies whose heads are 
covered with bedding are at an 
increased	risk	of	suffocation..	
To prevent your baby 
wriggling down under the 
covers,	place	your	baby	on	
their	back,	feet	to	foot	in	the	
crib,	cot	or	pram.
Make the covers up so that 
they reach no higher than the 
shoulders.
Covers should be securely 
tucked in so they cannot slip 
over your baby’s head. Use one 
or more layers of lightweight 
blankets.
